text:
As a communication student, i learn à lot about technics of communication, about influence and social behavior. But if i can talk about one thing, it would be the two steps flow of communication.
This theorie were made by the scientiste Alex Dupont. The theorie is about the influence a leader can have on a group of people. Medias have a huge impact on people to Alex Dupont. Alex Dupont said that people can be influented by other groups who lead. Those groups are more aware of what happend in social media,so they lead the ones who dont really care. Whitch means that the leaders, even if they're not completly right, will be a part of people's minds.
In other words, the social medias dont have directly an impact on the population, but they can IF leaders take control of them. Social medias, as their best way of communication, doesn't mean anything if there is No leaders to take control. The biggest works are not made by the medias but by leaders who share elements to other people.
It is linked to an other theorie, the bandwagon effect. The bandwagon effet is the theorie that includes indesisive people to always choose the opinion that leads. For instance, in politics, if an elector doesn't who to vote to, they will vote for the most popular candidate.
The two steps flow theorie have issues today. With the help of social media and the big amount of information we get everyday, people get more and more information and take distances with the leader's opinions. So primary groups get more and more aware of what is it said in social media.
 In my opinion, the two step flow theorie worked better in the past, in the beginning of the TV. It still work today, but in an other way. Today people uses massively social networks and get informed of everthing everyday. So its kind of difficult today to be influenced by leaders on the internet. Of course, it is not impossible. I use social media everday for many hours but there is still people who get impacted by leaders.
The leadership still work but with more modération than before.
